alert.note: Alert for Luna (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 06 at 12:01PM MST until March 06 at 1:30PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 130 PM MST. * At 1201 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was over Deming. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery and observational sources. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 81 and 94. Locations impacted include... Deming, Sunshine, Rock Hound State Park and Spring Canyon State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
